snippet: The inspector general for the intelligence community concluded that investigators should have more closely scrutinized Tamerlan Tsarnaev after he traveled to Russia in 2012.
abstract: Report from Office of the Intelligence Community Inspector General says federal agencies 'generally' acted appropriately in investigating Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev in years leading up to Boston Marathon bombing; concludes they should have more closely scrutinized Tamerlan when he returned to United States from Dagestan in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The inspector general for the intelligence community concluded that investigators should have more closely scrutinized Tamerlan Tsarnaev after he traveled to Russia in 2012.

headline.main: U.S. Agencies ‘Generally’ Acted Properly Before Boston Bombing, Report Says
headline.print_headline: U.S. Agencies ‘Generally’ Acted Properly Before Boston Bombing, Report Says
